snippet.title: Brain Breaks for Kids in the Classroom: Dozer's Hip Hop!
snippet.description: Teachers and parents, get your kids up and moving with this great brain break for kids! Whether you need a brain break for kids in the classroom or at home, Dozer's Hip Hop is sure to get your kids up and dancing and having fun - all while learning simple adjectives such as: small, high, tall, loud, big, quiet, crazy, and silly.

Thanks Israel!

snippet.title: Echo Dance | Brain Breaks | Fun Song For Kids | Follow Directions | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Echo Dance is a wonderful dance, rhyming and brain breaks song that is perfect for the early childhood classroom.  Echo Dance is full of simple and easy rhymes, movements and repeat after me motions.

Children are totally engaged with echoing all the words that I sing while engaging in different dances.  Rhyming awareness and listening for rhymes is so important in language development for the young child.
  
Children who are able to distinguish different sounds and phonemes are more likely to develop stronger literacy skills over time (Ehri et al. 2001). Music supports this critical skill because songs include rhyming or substituting one sound for another (US Dept. of Health and Human Services).

Children can follow me in my dance moves and repeat after me rhyming lines.  This movement and rhyming song is wonderful for a fun and effective brain breaks activity.

LYRICS:

The Echo Dance

Let's do it, let's do it, The Echo Dance
Let's do it, let's do it, The Echo Dance
With your hips, with your arms, with your hands
Follow me, do the Echo Dance

Do the twist, just like this                       (children repeat each line)
Do the shake, it's a piece of cake
Do the hop, don't you stop
Do the swing, it's a groovy thing

Let's do it, let's do it, The Echo Dance
Let's do it, let's do it, The Echo Dance
With your hips, with your arms, with your hands
Follow me, do the Echo Dance

Do the stomp, you can really romp
Do the choo choo train, right down the lane
Do the swim, like you've got fins
Do the monkey, it's really funky

Let's do it, let's do it, The Echo Dance
Let's do it, let's do it, The Echo Dance


https://youtu.be/e9FNz80g_7Y

Filmed at Suite 4K Studios:
http://www.suite4k.com/

This video made possible thanks to the support of the St. Petersburg, Clearwater Film Commission Digital Creator Studio program:
http://www.filmspc.com/

snippet.title: BEST OPTICAL ILLUSIONS TO KICK START YOUR BRAIN
snippet.description:
Here is a portion of the best optical illusions to kick-start your brain! Some of these tricky optical illusion games will break your mind! Try to focus on solving them and don't let anything bother you. These tricky brain games and puzzles will not just warm up your brain but also exercise it well.

00:14 - Can you read what's written in here? It's a cool way to test your brain!  If you can see these words and sentences clearly then probably you have a well-trained brain.
02:03 - Let's see how attentive you are! Find cute pandas in these pictures and try to do it as quick as possible.
03:51 - Can you tell for sure if it's the same photo?! Take your time and try to find differences between these pictures!
05:14 - Hard riddles that adults fail, but kids crack without any effort! Well, some kids do fail, but not many of them. To crack these tricky riddles for kids, you'll need to distance yourself from the picture and let your eyes just wander around and suddenly you'll start to see the hidden words everywhere 😮 
07:20 - Amazing optical illusion riddles and brain games to test your vision and brain as well! If your brain elastic (as it should be) then you will easily read all of them, however, if your brain is not stretched, then you should add up more into your brain exercises routine! 😎
09:32 - Can you guess right if these are real or fake? Sometimes it's almost impossible to find the right answer. These optical illusions will immediately blow your mind! 
11:16 - Put on your glasses and try to see who is hiding here! Only those with perfect vision will crack these optical illusion puzzles and will be to tell us who is hidden in the last illusion picture 🤓 

TELL me IN THE COMMENTS which optical illusion made you stuck in front of the screen for quite a time!

snippet.title: Dancing Star |  Dance Song for Kids  | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Brain Breaks engage children with tons of physical education activities, dancing, creative movements, counting, patterning, shapes, freeze dance, self-esteem and more.

Dancing Star can be compared to the hugely popular Cha Cha Slide. Children follow directions and move together.

You can use brain breaks to start your day, anytime children need a positive physical activity, after lunch or for indoor recess on days with bad weather.

When I perform any of my brain breaks songs in concert, children love it. Dancing Star is no exception.

My brain breaks songs can be used in physical education classes too. Teachers love how the children have to stop and put their hands to their ears to listen carefully. This is a great song to teach children about following directions.
Dancing Star Words and Music by Jack Hartmann, copyright 2011 Jack Hartmann www.jackhartmann.com 

LYRICS:

Dancing Star
 
Watch me, watch me I can raise the roof 
Watch me, watch me I can shake it loose  Chorus 
Shake it down then jump it up so far
I can shine like a dancing star 
 
Let’s get loose and warm it up 
All together, step to the front
 Jump to the back and clap 
Raise your arms up in the air 
Back and forth like you just don’t care
 Right leg stomp to the left
 Left leg stomp to the right 
One arm up shake your hips 
I can disco just like this Now stop and pose 
Be cool, slide to the right 
Be cool, slide to the left Jump up and count 
 
Robo dance, move it, block it like a robot You got it 
 
(Chorus) 
 
 
Now everybody square it up 
Step to the back, slide to the right 
Step to the front, slide to the left 
Now cabbage patch, arms circle around, be cool get down
 Country dance, stomp and clap 
Now turn around, clap like this 
Turn around again, clap like this 
Right leg stomp to the left, left leg stomp to the right 
Now jump up, criss-cross, criss-cross 
Shake your shoulders, shake your hips 
Shake it like a salt shaker, like this
 Now turn around, clap like this 
Turn around again, clap like this 
your own dance, dance free
 Now freeze Let’s cool it down, do the sprinkler 
Take it down, that was fun, we’re done 

Dancing Star is on my album, Brain Breaks:
https://www.jackhartmann.com/album/brain-breaks-brain-breaks-by-jack-hartmann/
tags: watch me watch me i can raise the roof

snippet.title: Brain Breaks | Calendar Song | Springtime Dance | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Celebrate spring with this super fun spring song that will motivate all young children to move and dance! Springtime Dance can be used as a great brain breaks activity too to help get lots of wiggles out and get everyone thinking about spring. Teachers and parents can use this upbeat dance song to introduce so many topics about spring ( ie. flowers ready to bloom, grass and the leaves on trees growing again and turning green, the weather getting warmer, getting closer to the last months of school, bugs and insects, and lots more )

Springtime Dance can also highlight your spring calendar lessons and learning about the seasons and how they are a cycle and go round and round. Spring is also a time we can more of our animal friends.

Let your children dance and sing to celebrate spring with Springtime Dance!

LYRICS:

Springtime Dance

It’s Spring!
Flowers grow, reach for the sun
Beautiful colors for everyone      Chorus
The season of winter now has passed
Spring is here, do the Springtime dance

Bunny Hop, it’s Springtime
Bird dance, it’s Springtime
Sprinkler, it’s Springtime
Flower dance, it’s Springtime

Flowers grow, reach for the sun
Beautiful colors for everyone      Chorus
The season of winter now has passed
Spring is here, do the Springtime dance

Bunny Hop, it’s Springtime
Bird dance, it’s Springtime
Sprinkler, it’s Springtime
Flower dance, it’s Springtime

Flowers grow, reach for the sun
Beautiful colors for everyone      Chorus
The season of winter now has passed
Spring is here, do the Springtime dance

snippet.title: Online Kids Classes #41 ♫ Get Funky ♫ Brain Breaks for Children ♫ Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Online Kids Classes  #41 ♫ Music and movement for preschoolers by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station): Welcome to The Learning Station’s online/virtual classroom for children. Here is a list of the action, dance, brain breaks, movement, exercise and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤Get Funky (Fun, Silly Live Action Song) (Also, known as the Funky Monkey)
❤12 Months of the Years (Learn the Months Movement Song)
❤Willy Dilly Diddle Hop (Fun, Silly Action Song)
❤Find the Shapes Out-Takes (Fine Shapes and Out-takes)
**************************************************************************
Get Funky(Also, known as the Funky Monkey) is a great brain breaks action, dance song to make it easy and fun to take a quick energy break.  When children take a moment to sing, dance and move then they can return to their academics feeling happy, energized and renewed. Schools are realizing the significant values of brain breaks in the classroom. This brain breaks dance song is perfect for preschool, kindergarten, elementary and physical education.

Get Funky (Also, known as the Funky Monkey)
From the CD, Get Funky and Musical Fun
By The Learning Station 
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 
LYRICS:
(Activity: This can be done as a line dance. Follow the directions.)
Are you ready to dance and boogie? Let's go. Get in line.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Step to the right and shake. Step to the left and snake. Step backwards. Step forwards.
Now jump. Jump again.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Now slide to the right real smooth. Slide to the left in the groove.
Right foot stomp. Stomp two times. Left foot stomp. Stomp two times.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Jump, jump two times. Jump, jump two times.
Now reach and sway and shake it your way.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Can you hear me? Can you hear me now? (4X)
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Take two steps to the right and shimmy. Two steps to the left, now gimmie a backstroke.
Jump, jump two times.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Jump two times. Right foot stomp. Jump three times. Left foot stomp.
Jump, jump two times. Jump, now, freeze.
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Reach, now touch the floor. Twist, do you want some more?
Chorus: Get funky. Do the monkey. Get clappy. Get happy.
Can you hear me? Can you hear me now?

snippet.title: If You're a Kid... (Earth Day Remix!)    [song for kids about going green]
snippet.description:
WWW.HARRYKINDERGARTENMUSIC.COM
...or find me on Teachers Pay Teachers!
www.teacherspayteachers.com/Store/Harry-­Kindergarten-Music
HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC, LLC
Hip educational songs & videos for the K-2 Classroom!

Song: IF YOU'RE A KID... (EARTH DAY REMIX!)
Educational Content: This is the EARTH DAY REMIX version of my popular "If You're a Kid" song. Students can follow along in the verses as they are asked to follow "Earth Day-themed" directions, based on if they are a boy or a girl (ex: throw away litter, unplug your plugs, turn off the water, recycle, etc.) In the chorus, ALL students are encouraged to dance around "if they are GREEN!"

Download/purchase this song directly at Teachers Pay Teachers by following this link:
https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/If-Youre-a-Kid-EARTH-DAY-REMIX-video-1913149

Buy! *www.harrykindergartenmusic.com
Buy! *www.teacherspayteachers.com/Store/Harry­-Kindergarten-Music
Watch! *youtube.com/harrykindergarten
Discuss! * facebook.com/groups/harrykindergarten
Tweet! * twitter.com/harrykmusic
Logo Merchandise! * cafepress.com/harrykindergarten
Pledge! *patreon.com/harrykindergarten
Email! *pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com

HARRY KINDERGARTEN MUSIC FREEBIES:
This song is a FREEBIE. You can stream it for free on YouTube, but also buy it at my website. I am already offering 60+ of my hip educational songs/videos on YouTube FOR FREE at youtube.com/harrykindergarten. Enjoy them, utilize them, and share them! I am a current full-time Kindergarten teacher so I know what it's like to be looking around for quality content in my classroom! You can ALSO purchase the raw video file and/or audio file of those 60+ songs at my website (if you need them for some reason) or at Teachers Pay Teachers. I will continue to make freebie videos (ones you can just stream on YouTube for free) periodically, so continue to check back to see if I've posted any. 

*Please DO NOT rip any of my videos off of YouTube and upload them to your YouTube channel. I want the Harry Kindergarten Music channel to be the hotspot for these videos, not random teachers' channels who happened to illegally take them off of mine. If you really want to have a playlist of them, create a playlist from MY channel or purchase them on my website so you have the raw files. THANKS FOR UNDERSTANDING!

Q: Do you speak at conferences?
A: Yes! My ability to speak at teacher conferences during the school year is "tight" because I am currently a classroom teacher and only have a set number of personal days. However, the SUMMER time is wide-open and I'd love to come to your conference and do a session/seminar! Some of the topics I've typically spoken to teachers about include music and technology in the classroom, classroom management, running a creative morning meeting, and utilizing YouTube in the early childhood classroom. Email me at pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com to make a speaking request.

Q: Can my class perform a "Harry Kindergarten song" for an audience?
A: If you desire to have your class or group of students perform one of my “Harry Kindergarten” songs for an audience, please note that there is a $6.00 PERFORMANCE FEE.

Here are some hypothetical examples of performance groups:
* Students perform a song for an audience during a graduation ceremony.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school or community talent show.
* Students perform a song for an audience during a school assembly.
If you are unsure if you need to purchase a performance license or not, please inquire at: pete@harrykindergartenmusic.com. If you want more details about using a song multiple years or multiple classes, etc., e-mail me for a detailed PDF file. 

$6.00 can be sent to:

Harry Kindergarten Music, LLC

508 Stewart Street

Bellwood, PA 16617

snippet.title: Welcome to Brain Breaks!!!
snippet.description: Brain breaks are a series of short videos designed to get our kids moving in short bursts of fun exercise during their school work. They have been designed to get the whole body moving in short but fun videos. It is important for our kids to move as they are spending large amounts of time sitting down and this series has been designed to get them moving in between different bits of set work.

Your kids will love performing our popular Boom Chicka Boom Graduation thank you, action and dance song for kids with lyrics, “Boom Chicka Boom Graduation is available in single song download: https://goo.gl/YMFAen

Boom Chicka Boom - Graduation Song for Kids (Graduation Song for Preschool & Kindergarten – Thank you, Action and Dance Graduation Kids Song) 
by The Learning Station®                                                               
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
LYRICS:
(This is a repeat after me song. So make sure your repeat the action & words)
Congratulations to the graduating class. Before we turn the page to the next stage in our lives we’d like to sing this song to you.  This is a repeat after me song. So make sure you repeat everything I say and do.

snippet.title: Hand Model of the Brain for KIDS by Jeanette Yoffe - Dan Siegel *** Hand Model of the Brain
snippet.description:
Child Psychotherapist, Jeanette Yoffe, MFT explains the kid version of Daniel Siegel's HAND MODEL OF THE BRAIN. Buy EYE FINGER PUPPETS Here: https://amzn.to/3eNlJWD

Check out Jeanette's LISTS of RECOMMENDED BOOKS - FOR KIDS/ADULTS BY TOPICS such as Birth, IVF, Foster Care, Adoption, Open Adoption, Attachment, Addiction, Trauma, Being a Family, Cancer, Divorce, LGBTQ, Identity, Grief/Loss, Worry & Anxiety, Self-Esteem, Teen Support:
https://www.amazon.com/shop/jeanette-icallyspeaking

Share with children ages 3 and up, provide them with finger puppets for their animal part and googly eyes for their higher brain.

See JEANETTE'S PLAYLIST FOR KIDS VIDEOS HERE:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv3YZUTYaRRtoGgIB_slBK2_2kylL-hTM

Please subscribe for NEW weekly videos:
https://www.youtube.com/user/JeanetteYoffe/videos

This film made by Nik Shaw

Visit Jeanette's Amazon Author Page 
https://www.amazon.com/M.F.T.-Jeanette-Yoffe/e/B07V9L93XF

Learn more about support for birth, adoptive and foster families in Los Angeles at https://celiacenter.org/

Jeanette is a child/family/adult therapist with a special focus on adopted and foster care issues which derived from her own experience of being adopted and moving through the foster care system in New York City. Her personal experience has informed her education and provided insight into the unique stresses involved with these issues. Because of Jeanette’s life experience she can more easily connect and relate to the children and teens she works with. She is an exceptional child-care worker who is dedicated to helping each of her clients reach their full potential through mental health therapy and make the difficult journey from despair towards resiliency and hope.

snippet.title: Brain Breaks | Around The World | Brain Breaks Song | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Around the World is a great Brain Breaks and exercise song. This brain breaks song also teaches children some basic spatial concepts (front, back, side to side and right and left and number awareness).

Classroom teachers and physical education teachers can do with children quickly and easily everyday. 

It engages children with extended arm circle moves and full body stretching and counting out loud. It also includes some basic subtraction as each time we stretch all around one number is taken away.  The repetition of this in the song makes it so simple and easy to follow.

Children can really get some exercise participating in all the moves in this song. It's a good workout song and the children will have fun moving together. It also builds endurance as this song really gets you moving for several minutes continually.

I just love the beat with some cool pop country music makes you want to do it too.

snippet.title: Silly Pirate Song | Brain Breaks | Growing Pattern Song | Educational Songs | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Silly Pirate Song is an educational song for kids that covers sequencing, following a growing pattern, comprehension and story recall. All these skills are very important developmental skills for young children. 

This pirate song for kids continues to be one of my most popular original songs. Children really use their imaginations as they act out each character's part. This movement on this children's pirate song is super fun.

Teachers and Parents can extend the learning after the video by asking these questions. 

Who is your favorite character?

Can you tell me what order the characters appear in?

How many characters did you see?

The simple rhythm and great melody of Silly Pirate Song continues to make this pirate song for kids a favorite of children around the world.

LYRICS:

Silly Pirate Song

Once there was a pirate who sang a pirate song
Then interrupting the pirate, a surfer came along

You’d hear…Yo, ho, ho, hee,hee, hee
Hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Hey dude surfs up
A pirate’s life for me

Repeat Chorus Line

A big shark came along
You’d hear…Yo, ho, ho ho, hee, hee, hee
Chomp, chomp, hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line

A helicopter came along
You’d hear… Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Swoosh, swoosh, chomp, chomp, hey,
dude surfs up
A pirates life for me
Repeat

Repeat chorus Line

An octopus came along
You’d hear… Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Wiggle wiggle, swoosh, swoosh, chomp, chomp,
Hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line

A submarine came along
You’d hear…
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
Up periscope, wiggle, wiggle, swoosh,
Swoosh, chomp, chomp, hey dude, surf up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line
A singing mermaid came along
You’d hear… Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee
La, La, la, up periscope
Wiggle, wiggle, swoosh, swoosh chomp, chomp
hey dude, surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, hee, hee, hee

Repeat Movements
Repeat Chorus Line

A police boat came along
You’d hear…Yo,ho,ho,hee,hee,hee
Stop-freeze, la,la,la, up periscope
Wiggle, wiggle, swoosh, swoosh,
Chomp, chomp, he dude surfs up
A pirates life for me
Yo, ho, ho, ho, hee hee, hee

Repeat Movements

A pirates life for me
A pirates life is…not for me!
There are too many interruptions!

For more great videos like this one, check out my educational DVDs:
http://www.jackhartmann.com/dvds/

For more fun educational songs like this one, check out my CD bundle:
http://www.jackhartmann.com/tooty-ta-rrific-bundle/

snippet.title: Brain Breaks | Rags | Brain Breaks Song | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Kids absolutely love this popular kids movement and rhyming song about a dog named Rags.  It’s a great brain breaks activity to get kids singing, moving and hearing the fun rhyming and language play of flip – flop, wig – wag & zig – zag.  

All young kids love singing this catch phrase and follow in the fun movements I do on the video.  Rags is just fantastic for developing rhyming awareness, listening skills and gross motor movement.

Rags is like a super fun nursery rhyme with lots of movement.  I sing this song “live” at many of my concerts and it’s always a great favorite to get everybody moving, smiling and singing.  

Rags is simply a wonderful brain breaks song, a rhyming awareness and language play song and just a fun movement song everyone enjoys.

Lyrics
I've got a dog and his name is Rags
He eats so much that his tummy sags
His ears flip-flog and his tail wig wags
And when he walks he walks zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
I love Rags and he loves me

My dog Rags he loves to play
He rolls around in the mud all day
I call him, he doesn't obey
He always runs the other way
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
I love Rags and he loves me

He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag
I love Rags and he loves me
I love Rags and he loves me
He goes flip -flop, wig-wag, zig-zag

snippet.title: Dr. Jean's Banana Dance - (aka The Guacamole Song) - Dr. Jean's Banana Dance
snippet.description:
Dr. Jean has released this song and video on youtube for teachers and parents to enjoy with their children. 

Watch top left corner for a link to the lyrics around 42 seconds. Or, use this link: http://drjean.org/html/youTube.html. If you check the lyrics, you will soon learn whether it is form or farm. 

All of Dr. Jean's music is available on iTunes. This song is on the CD set Better Bodies and Brains.The song is available on iTunes and Amazon.

You learn on your feet, not on your seat! When children move, dance, and wiggle, more senses are activated and the message is more likely to get to the brain. Music and movement also emit endorphins which make you happy. These activities are great for cardio, eye-hand coordination, flexibility, strength, and children's BRAINS! Children will also develop body spatial awareness, cooperation, self-control, social skills, and they will learn to listen and follow directions. It feels good to feel good, and when children feel good their behavior improves! See more at drjean.org

Here are the top ten reasons to SING every day!

1. When you sing your brain emits endorphins, and endorphins make you happy!  Emotions are critical to learning.

2. Music is multi-sensory.  The more senses you get going to the brain, the more likely the message will get there.

3. Music is powerful for prior-learning.  If children are exposed to concepts while singing, it is easier for them to learn when formally introduced.

4. Music nurtures phonemic awareness (alliteration, rhyme, etc.).

5. Songs and chants are a natural way to develop oral language and auditory memory.

6. Poems and songs lay a foundation for fluency and enhance short term memory.

7. Children are able to use their imaginations and create pictures in their brains when they sing.  This is an important part of reading comprehension.

 8. Repetition is a key to learning.  It is much more fun to repeat songs than worksheets!

 9. Singing and dancing relieve stress and oxygenate the brain.

10. Through music and movement ALL children can feel successful.  A “community of learners” is enhanced when teachers and children enjoy something together!

There was a study that was reported on National Public Radio called “Alive Inside.”  In the research study they made iPods of songs that had a special significance to patients suffering from dementia and Alzheimer’s.  These patients didn’t recognize family members, but when they heard the music they tapped their feet, sang the words, and smiled!  So many things that we do in our classrooms will be forgotten, but the songs will be stored in children’s brains for a lifetime!  What a privilege to be able to do this!
tags: top ten reasons to SING every day

1. When you sing your brain emits endorphins, and endorphins make you happy!  Emotions are critical to learning.

2. Music is multi-sensory.  The more senses you get going to the brain, the more likely the message will get there.

3. Music is powerful for prior-learning.  If children are exposed to concepts while singing, it is easier for them to learn when formally introduced.

4. Music nurtures phonemic awareness (alliteration, rhyme, etc.).

5. Songs and chants are a natural way to develop oral language and auditory memory.

6. Poems and songs lay a foundation for fluency and enhance short term memory.

7. Children are able to use their imaginations and create pictures in their brains when they sing.  This is an important part of reading comprehension.

 9. Singing and dancing relieve stress and oxygenate the brain.

10. Through music and movement ALL children can feel successful.  A “community of learners” is enhanced when teachers and children enjoy something together!

snippet.title: Online / Virtual Class Learning #3 ♫ Brain Breaks & Learning ♫ Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Welcome to our online/virtual class for children. Here are a list of the action, dance and learning songs we will be performing today: 
If You're Wearing Colors (Learning Colors Song for Kids.)
Tony Chestnut (Brain Breaks, Action and Dance Song for Kids.)
Baby Shark (Brain Breaks, Action and Dance Song for Kids.)
7 Days in a Week (Learning the Days of the Week.)
A Root Chy Cha (Brain Breaks, Action and Dance Song for Kids.)
If You're Wearing Colors is on our award-winning CD, “Get Funky”. “Get Funky” CD Download: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/product/get-funky-cd-download/ 
“Get Funky” CD: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/product/get-funky-cd/

If You're Wear Colors From the CD, Get Funky by The Learning Station® 
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.) 
LYRICS: 
If You’re Wearing Colors

If you’re wearing red stand up and shake your head. 
If you’re wearing green stand up and bow to the queen. 
Stand up no matter what color’s on you. Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do. 
If you’re wearing yellow stand up and shake like Jell-O. 
If you’re wearing black stand up and pat your back. 
Stand up no matter what color’s on you. Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do. 
If you’re wearing blue stand up and touch your shoe. 
If you’re wearing brown stand up and spin around. 
Stand up no matter what color’s on you. Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do. 
If you’re wearing gray stand up and holler hey! 
If you’re wearing white stand up and turn to the right. 
Stand up no matter what color’s on you. Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do. 
If you’re wearing tan stand up and wave your hands. 
If you’re wearing purple stand up and turn in a circle. 
Stand up no matter what color’s on you. Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do. 
If you’re wearing pink stand up and wink, wink, wink. 
If you’re wearing peach stand up and reach, reach, reach. 
Stand up no matter what color’s on you. Now, sit down and clap till we sing what to do.
Tony Chestnut
From the CD, Tony Chestnut & Fun Time Action Songs
by The Learning Station 
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
Tony Chestnut (Toe Knee Chest Nut) Lyrics and Movements:
Tony Chestnut knows I love you.   (Point to your toes, knees, chest, head, nose, eyes, heart and to a friend.) 
Tony knows.  Tony knows. (Point to your toes, knees and nose.) 
Tony Chestnut knows I love you. (Point to your toes, knees, chest, head, nose, eyes, heart and to a friend.) 
That's what Tony knows. (Point to your toes, knees and nose.)                                                          
Tony, Tony and his sister Eileen.  (Point to your toes, knees, toes, knees then lean to the right.)
And Eileen loves Neil and Neil loves Pat.  (Everyone lean to the right, kneel and pat your shoulders.)
But Pat still loves Bob. (Pat your shoulders and bounce your head back and forth.)
And there's Russell and Skip.  (Standup, wiggle your legs then skip in place.) 
This song is silly, but it's hip. (Make a silly face then stick out your right hip and point to it.)
How it ends, just one man knows. (Turn and point to your bottom.)
And guess what (what), it's Tony Chestnut.  (Hold your arms up in the air.  Point to your toes, knees, chest and head.) 
**************************

snippet.title: Otters | Ollie the Otter Karaoke | Educational Songs | YouTube for Kids | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
This version of Ollie the Otter is karaoke style with the lyrics appearing on screen with the video. In this video you can sing along with Jack Hartmann as you watch Ollie the Otter play in the lake outside Jack Hartmann's office. Ollie is a frequent visitor and enjoys catching fish and sunning himself on the banks of the lake.

Ollie the Otter  - This brain break has children wiggling, diving, popping up and swimming to the bouncing beat as they act out the movements of Ollie the Otter.  Learning about sea life and the otter’s habitat is part of this fun sing-a-long. 

LYRICS:

There's a very special animal that lives down by the lake
All the children go to see him as he swims and dives and plays
But he’s just a little shy sometimes in his own special way
So the children all say hey to him and they call out his name
They say ...  

Hey, hey, Ollie the Otter
Playing in the water              Chorus
 having so much fun
Hey, hey Ollie the Otter
Playing in the water 
 having so much fun
Bridge    
Go Ollie go, Wiggle, wiggle, jiggle and jump
Go Ollie go, Dive right down and pop right up
Play Ollie play, play and swim all around
Play Ollie play, you look so happy, you look so proud
And, oh, how Ollie loves to play
You can hear all the children say
Chorus

snippet.title: Dr. Jean's Banana Dance - (aka The Guacamole Song) - Dr. Jean's Banana Dance
snippet.description:
Dr. Jean has released this song and video on youtube for teachers and parents to enjoy with their children. 

Watch top left corner for a link to the lyrics around 42 seconds. Or, use this link: http://drjean.org/html/youTube.html. If you check the lyrics, you will soon learn whether it is form or farm.
